title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
4 points are earned: For each correct force on the dot for which the vector drawn has the correct direction and a correct label such as those in the figure above, 1 point was earned.

No points were earned for an appropriately labeled force if the direction was incorrect. 1 earned point was deducted for each additional force or component.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Applying Newton’s second law to the forces perpendicular to the plane

ΣF⏊ = ma⏊, where, a⏊ = 0
N - Fg cosθ = 0
N - mg cosθ = 0

1 point is earned: For a correction expression for the normal force

N = mg cosθ (or N = mg sinθ, if 70° was clearly used for θ)

1 point is earned: For correctly substituting the values of m, g and θ into the correct expression

N = (50kg) (9.8m / s2) cos 20°

N = 460N (or, 470N, u sin g, g = 10m / s2)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For a correct expression for the component of the force of gravity parallel to the plane

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For a correct expression for the frictional force

f = μKN

1 point is earned: For correct substitution of μK and the value of N from part (b)

f = (0.30)(460 N)

f = 138 N (or 141 N using the g = 10 m/s2 result of N = 470 N from (b))

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Applying Newton’s second law to the forces parallel to the plane

F net∥ = ∑ F ∥ =m a ∥ , MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOramaaBa aaleaacaWGUbGaamyzaiaadshacqWILicuaeqaaOGaeyypa0Zaaabq aeaacaWGgbWaaSbaaSqaaiablwIiqbqabaaabeqab0GaeyyeIuoaki abg2da9iaad2gacaWGHbWaaSbaaSqaaiablwIiqbqabaGccaGGSaaa aa@4519@ where a‖ = 0 because the box is moving at constant speed

1 point is earned: For indicating Fnet‖ = 0

Fnet‖ = Fp - Fg‖ - f = 0

1 point is earned: For correct substitutions of the answers from parts (c) and (d) into a correct expression

Fp = Fg‖ + f
Fp = 168N + 138N
Fp = 306N (or 312N, u sin g, the, g = 10m/s2 results, of, Fg‖ = 171N, and, f = 141N)

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For a correct expression relating work to force and distance

W = Fdcosφ, where φ is the angle between F and d (W = force times distance must be implied, not W = mgh.
